resources:
KeyCip
Welcome Thank you for downloading KeyCip. You are closer to having more control over the information you upload to different services on the internet. Continue
What does KeyCip? KeyCip is an application that allows you to encrypt and decrypt text, photographs, videos, documents and other files. To do this, it uses the RSA (mainly) and AES encryption algorithms (generating and managing the sets of keys). Need help? I am already familiar with encryption algorithms.
What does encryption mean? Encrypting a text, photograph, video or document means hiding its content so that only a specific person can know that information. This ensures that when the encrypted text, photograph, video or document is sent, its content remains confidential.
What does it mean to decrypt? Decrypting a text, photograph, video or document is the reverse of encrypting. In other words, the original content is returned to the encrypted file by a certain process.
What does it mean to sign? Signing a text, photograph, video or document is similar to signing a letter. The content of the text or file is not changed or hidden but allows the recipient to confirm that the person who sent it is indeed the person he or she claims to be.
Is it possible to sign and encrypt at the same time? By signing and encrypting, you keep the content of what you send confidential, while giving the recipient the opportunity to verify your identity.
What is an encryption algorithm? An encryption algorithm is the set of steps that must be carried out to encrypt, decrypt or sign any text or file. In our case, RSA is used.
What is a public key? This is the key that you will share with your contacts. When one of them wants to send you an encrypted text or file so that only you can know the actual content, they will use this key to encrypt it.
What is a private key? With this key, you will decrypt the encrypted messages sent to you.
Where are these keys stored? Because these are personal keys, they will never leave your phone, nor do we have access to them (in fact, the application does not connect to the internet).
Too complicated? Don\'t worry, the application is simple and will guide you through the whole process of encrypting, decrypting and signing. In addition, you can access this tutorial whenever you want to review concepts.
Generate public and private keys Once you are familiar with encryption and decryption, you will generate the keys to make use of RSA. Generate keys First, a numerical pattern will be set and you will be prompted when you want to perform an encryption, decryption or signature operation. Set pattern
Set a five-figure pattern. Confirms the five-figure pattern.
Use alternative authentication methods . It has been detected that you have alternative authentication methods (such as fingerprint). Do you want to use them as well? Remember that the PIN inserted must be five digits long. No PIN has been entered PIN does not match
Set the name to which your keys will be associated. The name cannot be empty
The public and private keys are being generated. This may take a few seconds
Public and private key generated. Public key sharing Remember that in order for your contacts to encrypt or decrypt, they must download the application. Send invitation to download application Sharing your public key Sharing the public key of You are one download away from being able to control who has access to the information you upload to different services on the Internet. Download KeyCip at https://developer.android.com/training/sharing/send
Permits. We need you to grant us permission to internal storage when you need to encrypt, not decrypt files. Granting permissions Permits granted Without access to internal storage, you will not be able to encrypt/decrypt or sign files or photos/videos. You must grant permissions manually
Permits. All the functions of the application are available on a keyboard so that you don\'t have to leave the social network or application you are in when you want to encrypt or decrypt a file. Set KeyCip as main keypad
It took us a while but we\'re done now.
Generate a new key pair. A new key pair is going to be generated . Please note that this operation means that the people with whom you shared your previous public key will no longer be able to use it (and you will have to share it again). Do you want to continue?
Sharing of public key Ask the person you wish to share your public key with to select the "Scan QR" option after pressing "Add contact".
Add a new contact. Public key attached correctly Enter the name of the contact Contact name
Contact information Contact name Last modification day Public key Sharing the contact\'s public key Edit contact Delete contact Are you sure you want to delete the contact? If you continue, you will no longer be able to perform encryption or decryption operations with this contact.
!-- Edit contact info--> Change the public key Do you want to leave? There are still unsaved changes that will be lost. Save changes Cancel changes
!-- Files fragment--> My files Messages Photos Videos PDF Other files
!-- Settings fragment--> Grant permission to internal storage View the tutorial with the key concepts Associate biometric authentication Remove biometric authentication You can visit our public repository where you will find the source code of the application. If you have a proposal, don\'t hesitate to participate.
!-- Encrypt fragment--> What operation do you wish to perform? Encrypt Decrypt Sign Encrypt and sign Check signature
Encrypt with your password or use a public one from one of your contacts? Encrypt for me Encrypt for someone else
Check signature with a specific key or try all available keys in your contacts? Verify signature using specific key Verify signature by testing all the keys in your phonebook
What do you want to encrypt? What do you want to sign? What do you want to sign and encrypt?
Text Photo or video Other file
Encrypting allows you to hide the content of the text, photograph or file.\nDecrypting returns the original content to the text or file\nSigning does not alter the file, but allows your contacts to check your identity If you encrypt for yourself, only you will be able to decrypt the content afterwards. \nIf you encrypt for someone else, only the person whose public key you choose in the next step will be able to decrypt it.
What do you want to decrypt? What kind of signature do you want to check? Text File .zip
